one_reviews_text: This game is only fun when you play  it! once it glitches out, YOUR DONE!  The graficts arent even that great! The only thing I like about it, is that iM A GOOD PLAYER  AND ITS  FUN.  IM ALSO MAD BECAUSE I SPENT 30 FREAKING MINUTS JUST TO TRY TO LOG IN.

First and foremost, Disregard the 1 star reviews. To those who left 1 star saying the game just crashes, go to the developer website hitechcreations and download the game again. I'm a flight combat fanatic with 25 yrs playing Ace Combat, IL2, Warbirds ect.. I discovered Aces High III in 2017 when I got my Oculus Rift and was instantly addicted to the extent I play 4 hours a day and have been for the past 3 years.
Why is this game so epic for me? Simply put, 
1.)Game speed, 
2.) Near zero load time (literally 1 minute from click game start to in air flying).
3.) Level of competition, As you may or may not know, Aces High launched in 1999 and added VR support in 2016. What you have after 20 years is a community of die hards that plays at a skill level Epic 10x. Better bring your A game to compete with this community. Three years later and I can now hold my own.
4.) The sheer number of Planes, Vehicles, Boats you can use in this game. Essentially every fighter, heavy fighter, bomber, Tank, mobile anti aircraft, ships guns from every major country in WWII is in this game and playable!!
5.) and the main reason for my 4 hrs a day in this game. Touch Controller integration in Aces High is without a doubt best in industry. So good it should be the industry standard for touch controller flying. As I've said, I have been a flight sim player for 25 yrs and Love my HOTAS. Aces High has made me put my HOTAS in the closet. It's a little akward at first, but with proper button mapping and just a little bit of practice, it becomes so second nature that your brain forgets you are holding a touch controller and not the actual flight stick in the cockpit. I swear I even feel resistive feedback.
6.) The incredible flight modeling. Dale Addink, the Game owner/developer is also a pilot and the flight modeling is so good that real pilots call it best in sims. You can very distinctly feel and experience the differences in all the planes in terms of climb rate, roll rate, dive etc etc.. FLY

review_title: Absolute Blast If You Have a Brain
one_reviews_text:
When I first found this game, I was instantly interested. A World War Two flight simulator? That works with Oculus Rift AND touch controllers? AND it has tanks? Incredible!

I did read some reviews of the game prior to dowloading it, and I saw that the game didn't have a very good reception on the Oculus Store. I figured that I didn't have anything to loose by trying it, however, so I downloaded it with low expectations. And man, am I glad that I did.

When I loaded into a game and selected a plane from the hangar, I was blown away. I was sitting in the actual cockpit of a Spitfire Mk I, a plane I had only previously flown in Il2 Cliffs of Dover. Although there were a few innacuracies (which I expected) the cockpit was actually modelled very well. All of the gauges and switches were (technically) functional, and it looked great. 

Gamplay was also very fun, with an in-depth flightmodel and damage model. The game's dynamic has you capturing enemy territory, fighting to destroy and then takeover enemy airfields and towns. And although I was a bit confused on what to do at first (other than shoot at enemy planes) I found the community to be quite helpful and friendly. I had a blast.

Tank gameplay wasn't quite as fun, since tank interiors aren't modelled and there isn't multicrew (come to think of it, there isn't multicrew anywhere in this game to my knowledge) but I still had a lot of fun trying to capture a nearby town in my M8 Greyhound.

I was left feeling pleasant surprised, but also confused. Why did the VR community have such a negative opinion of this game? Sure, the game has a few rough edges since it's literally a VR port of a 20+ year old game, but I still had a total blast and I've found myself playing it more and more. I was able to easily load in to the game (after a little wait to allow some "skins" to download, which happened literally one time), select a plane, and go shoot at bad guys.

I may never know. But I know one thing. This game is fun.

one_reviews_text:
This game is probably the best free flying game, but it’s hard to figure out. To pick your plane you will have to take the headset off, and use keyboard and mouse to navigate. Pick your sever, and go to the hanger. Pick a plane and the direction you want to fly. You should be in the plane. Hit escape to remove the clipboard. Now put on your headset and fly.

Your screen might go black. This is not a bug, it’s the fact your turning to fast, and have to many g’s. It’s disorienting, but accurate.

review_title: The game VR was made for
one_reviews_text:
This game has been out there for almost 20 years, but this was the game that VR was invented for. You strap on a WWII aircraft with accurate flight models and do combat with other players. You can dog fight, bomb, and attack ground targets. 
I will be honest, this is not an arcade game. This is a real combat sim, it takes time to learn. If you have any questions you can ask other players, most are willing to render assistance. Once you invest 10 hours in it I guarentee you will be hooked and will be spending many more hours with this game. It is subscription based, but it is the best $15 you ever spent.
I will admit that I havent had the time to learn the touch controls and have stuck with my stick and keyboard commands. 
The graphics are great, but to be honest that is not the focus of the game. 
I highly recomend giving this game 10 hours to learn. Once you do that you will have the skill level to compete. Look for me Toddbobe on the knight side.

it's ok

review_title: I had my doubts at first, but then...
one_reviews_text:
Im just gonna jump straight to it; Buy this! I am seriously amazed how well this game has transitioned to the VR platform. I understand its been around for quite some time (+ 15 years actually), and ive never heard of it, neither played it, although i am deep into flight sims! 

The controls at first sight seemed to be "dull" and "arcade", but i changed my opinion when this "dull and arcade" like control system completely removed the need for intrument and avionics multitasking, which works incredibly well in VR.

You got your two hands in the cockpit, there to grab the yoke and throttle controls. Thats the only things you can interact with in the cockpit, which to my suprise works really well. 

The motion controllers has a few mapped keys to them, like throttle up\down, for when you cant be bothered to reach out and grab them. You also got flaps, up\down, gears, main\secondary weaponchange, and the VOIP control, which utilize the thumb proximity\touch sensor as the InRange VOIP control, to transmit your voice to other aircraft in the immediate vicinity of yourself. Ive never seen any other game that uses the proximity\touch control, so this adds two new buttons to the controls, and it works beautifully well.
You also got the map key, bail out, and other smaller keymappings to them. 

Dogfighting is hard, very hard, since you grab the yoke with your controller, with no place to pivot it, like a traditional yoke, you'll find yourself pulling the stick over all places making you stall and\or shot down, however this is a thing you'll get to know better and then know to move the stick in incriments, and not wiggle it all over the place.

MP is absolutely awesome! Nuff' said!

You got aircraft, vehicles and a boat to choose from. All vehicles from American, British, Finnish, German, Italian, Japanese and Russian models, from the simplest British Spitfire, US P-51, German FW 190, Finnish Brewster, Italian C-202, Japanese A6M2 and Russian Yak-series, +bombers. 

BUY THIS!

review_title: Dumbing down of a once great game
one_reviews_text:
In its day when I first subscribed over ten years ago this game was an authentic combat simulator with hundreds of players interacting together in ground and ariel combat. It had such a following that some times during peaks play you could not enter an arena because it was full. It had everything going for it. Stuff to blow up.Combat that challenged you!! Then something happened and the developers must have decided that it was to hard, too authentic. or complex for the average player and it was reduced over the past 6 years to anything but authenic in nature, lossing most of its player base in the process. If participation trophies are your gig then this game will all but help you out with dusting them off and finding a nice shelf for them. I mean they literally have introduced a radar bar so you know when there is a ground vehicle(Just like in WWII?) . They all but put a big arrow over it telling you where to go. 
Otherwise its just not as impressive in this new simplified format  as Elite Dangerous, War Thunder or many others on the market where they have stayed with a winning combination that has kept original player base hooked. This game had an emense player following being a subscription game and they have reduced the original base of enthusiasts to a mere handful of players.  Graphics are okay in VR. Some aircraft are drop dead knock outs inside the cockpit but scale is also off giving it a toy pedal car  vibe.

Very very very good.  I am an ace pilot in just two days. I have shot about 5 planes in 15 hours. love the graphics and sunset, WORTH A TRY. you have to figure things out and THINK , LOOK AROUND, to find buttons and press differet buttons to learn what they do. Double pushing forward causes WEP engine turbo to turn on and things like that. you can do more but not sure how. head tracking amazing in a pilot. THIS IS AMAZING! Try it, dont let reviews spoil it. some are just dumb and dont know how to play and say 1 star. this is AWESOME.

review_title: This review before you decide Good Game!
one_reviews_text:
Okay, when I first got this game, I ripped it as the worst broken game ever.  The menu didn't work, and I couldn't get into the game. I thought it was just a broken forgotten game.   Well I have come to a complete 180! I guess they fixed the menus, and the game is NOT bad at all, especially for an arena dogfight multiplayer game saving on FPS.
The graphics are a bit low-poly, the textures are nice, but what I have to say it's all extremely homogenous.  It all looks good together, with some surprises.
I can't speak about multiplayer details or game mechanics so far, but as far as a VR Flight Sim, it's fantastic.   You can fly every kind of plane you can think of, plus tanks, vehicles and ships.  The B17 felt very realistic.  It's not DCS World, but it also leaves some things out that DCS World should leave out.

I hope people haven't panned this too badly and others discover this game, it's cult classic worthy, and would be great to see a strong community get behind it.

Pros:
-Very nice solid graphics that all work together.
-Controls are fair, can use a controller instead.
-Using Touch to control your plane gives a good challenge
-HUGE amount of vehicles to control
-Extremely good framerate
-Easy to play, hard to master
Cons:
-none graphic wise unless you are a stickler for absolutely top of the line in all your games.
-Touch controls are a little tough, but not as bad as other games, your hands don't fall off the controls.

I really think this is an overlooked sleeper.  I hope a community forms for this.

the game has the potentil to be a good game but it just is not it dose not give a realistic feel and needs alot of work if they where to make it easyer to understand and map your own controles it would be a good game but as of now it needs work

Unplayable. Clipboard pops up so close to your face that you can't focus on it. No way of making anything happen at all, stuttery and twitchy. I couldn't actually play the game as I couldn't read the menu or operate it.

Thanks to Aces high for making it compatable but I still found difficulty playing the game. The texture quality was average yet it dropped my framerate massively and so was still unplayable(even when I lowered the quality to the minimum). I am not sure if this applies to others as well , but it does to me.  What I did not like was that the major servers they had, I would have to pay monthy. If you are looking to gain some revenue off this game(or project), then   don't make the game free. Another problem(im not sure if I am accidentally clicking something on the controller )is when my position in game and view begins to change. Its hard to explain but heres the best way I can, in the menu(this is a example) when I move my head left and right, the menu screen begins to get closer to me, or when on the plane,my position on it constantly changes so that either I move away from the seat, or it changes so i am in front of the in game menu(Sorry if it is confusing, just ignore it if you dont understand).The controls were very complex, but I (sort of) managed. What I liked most was that you could control the plane as though you were literally flying it, increasing the immersion. In the end, I still think it is a good idea, but does need improvement. Out of all this, I think I am most concerned of is the monthly payments to play on popular servers. I think this should be put in a beta state until it meets the wants of the customers.

one_reviews_text: I have a 1080 Ti and the frame rate is dreadful, menus don't seem to work, and it generally seems very buggy. I guess this is a port to VR? Gave it 2 stars as it does seem to have some interesting features, but at the moment it's impossible to play for me.

review_title: Getting started is a bit of a puzzle
one_reviews_text: My initial attempt ran at 15fps. But a PC restart (and update for Aces High) and it ran at 90fps. Once you get used to having to use mouse to initially assign your controller axes/buttons etc then it gets a bit easier. Have done take offs and landings but am slightly puzzled by Missions - they seem somewhat odd - I would take off and randomly I was occasionally told something like 'base under attack' except it was not - unless the base is somewhere other than where I took off. I will persevere and see if I make any sense of it. But at present I have found it frustrating hence 3 stars.

I found that the touch controllers have little play in this game. You must use your mouse and keyboard to move and select things, this really brings you out of the vr experience. I suggest that you make the touch controllers work and make it more obvious how to get past that menu to even start playing. I could not figure out how to go back to the hanger or tower after entering a vehicle, it seemed to lock my mouse in firing mode and I had to force quit. Would not recommend
review_feedback: Touch Controllers are now fully supported.

one_reviews_text:
I had fun. The last time I flew a combat plane was Top Gun on the NES, so this was plenty different, yet about the same. However, it is clearly meant for the right set up, my game pad wasn’t cutting it. The plane was slow to respond to commands, and my eventual lift off after repeated crashes was a miracle. Which ended in ten seconds because I decided to swing around to buzz the airfield and the plane refused to climb out of an abrupt nose dive. 

If you’ve got the right set up it’s apparently great fun. But with a game pad, best of luck. Also, if you can't be fussed about wing flaps and learning to fly a virtual plane with no help, I’m guessing the game isn’t meant for you. The videos are rubbish unless you already play flight sims because the game pad got almost no response out of the controls, though the guns and throttle worked just fine. Also, the laugh in the narrarator’s voice wasn’t exactly inspiring, it’s like the devs wanted people to wash out. 

The community seems mostly nice though, and I was able to at least take off thanks to the advice in some of the reviews. I wish there had been dog fights offline where you could at least find some action but although the map was supposed to take me to one I never got there. I’m assuming because I crashed so many planes. So, if you are intensely into flight and war sims you will likely love it. But if you aren’t the learning curve is steep but doable. Best of luck!

This app is not as high quality as as war thunder, but it features many many many many tanks and planes you can go inside of and use their turrets in first person, my favorite experience was being a ball turret gunner on a B17, and using tanks from the cockpit view.... it could use a graphics improvemnt and a little of explanation in how to use things, but if you are a hardcore flight sim pilot like me, this app is a must.

Yes, yes, the UI ain't the greatest.  Even those of us who've been playing AH since the beginning will admit that.  It isn't any better in VR.  And the game wasn't meant for touch controls, despite allowing it.  It's not meant for arcade gamers either.  The monthly subscription helps keep the riff-raff out.  I'm happy for it.  Aces High is for hard core combat flight sim enthusiasts who are going to be playing it with a HOTAS.  VR is the next level of what's already one of the best combat sims available.   No more looking side-eye using an IR tracking device.  No more messing with hat switches.  Just eyes naturally on target at all time.  This (and other sims) is what I bought into VR for, and it doesn't disappoint.

If they had settled on a single control scheme I think it would have been fine but as is it's an excercise in frustration.

Apart from that it looks good..... will be keeping going with this to see if I can get it working properly.

I'm an old hand at flight sims. Adding VR should be amazing, right? Not if you can't control the plane. In fact, even the menus are made difficult because you have to poke at tiny buttons with an Oculus Touch finger. 

Once you get into the plane, you can't touch any controls except the flight stick, which thrashes around. Throttle is on the controller, but combined with rudder for some bizarre reason.

If they did some serious work on the menus and flight controls, it might be worth playing. Maybe. I never managed to get a plane off the ground.

When the clipboard with credits / options came up, I couldn't do anything. Couldn't select anything, couldn't highlight anything, never got in to the actual game. I tried the touch controllers, which didn't work either but gave me huge hands, so there's that.

review_title: VR brings a whole new dimension to this
one_reviews_text:
I've enjoyed flight sims decades now and for the past six years have been simming on triple 40" screens with Track IR and thought nothing could be better.  I was wrong.

Aces High is what VR was meant to be!  The sense of depth perception is incredible.  Whether its landing on Carriers, or doing a low level bombing raid hugging the tree tops, you really feel like you are in the world, not flying a flat stanley on a screen.

Well worth the download.  Fly offline a bit then dive into the two weeks free to test yourself against others.

No idea how to use my Oculus Touch in this. All I have is the dot to point my head at, and a mouse to click. I made it to the offline area, but the mouse won't control anything. The Touch sensors do nothing. All I managed to accomplish was pressing the =, and crashing. The mouse was absolutly uncontrollable.

This may be something great someday, but trying to hold a Touch controller, a mouse, and type on the keyboard, all while looking through VR glasses is absurd.
I have played WW2 MMO sims since the late 90's.  Air Warrior, Warbirds 1 & 2, and Aces High 1 - 3.  Oculus makes this an amazing experience.  Would reccomend to any aviation enthusiast.

The Flight sim and plane characteristics are excellent. Controller support and the like are great.  The issue is the new user experience and UI is difficult to overcome to retain new users.  Once past that learning curve, it can be a great game. I would suggest they get a Free to Play layer in their game to get people hooked before the monthly subscription though.

Very VERY early. Audio doesn't go to the Rift. Menu is small and awkward in VR. Positional tracking stops if you move too far forwards. Oculus Touch controllers show up, but controllers are misaligned with hands and buttons don't work. Fix the bugs and it *could* be a good game some day.
the worst UI ever...

Don't bother as this is one of the fastest uninstalls ever. The game crashed several times and the control scheme is garbage. Sorry I am not providing my name, address and e-mail in order to play your game. I know that the saying is when something is free I am the product but this is taking things a little too far. No thanks.
Great VR Gameplay probably the best you'll find in a flight combat sim right now. Feels like being inside the cockpit of a warbird. WW1 and WW2 planes to fly in combat with lots of other people.
Account creation must be done in VR using keyboard and mouse. After putting in my account creation information, it wouldn't work for an unknown reason as there are many graphical glitches.

really poor vr implemtation, ugly game. Menu system is not easy to navigate. I will stick to dcs, war thunder & il-2 when it does vr. I'm sure the 5 star reviews are shills on here because there are much better choices out there.
I saw videos and game looks nice, decided to try, then oh.. it requires a montly fee... no thanks... the game is not that good.

It seems that the positional tracking doesn't work very well in the cockpit.

DCS World is far far better, obviously ;-)
Best PC flight simulation. Active forum for new users seeking help.

Aces High is basically what VR was made for.  Dogfighting in the cockpit at 10,000 feet, 420 kts., closing one eye and lining up to lead the target, fill em full of cannon fire and watch the pieces bounce off your canopy and the plane go burning to the ground.  Hundreds of other pilots all contesting the same airspace in realtime.  Better than War THunder and DCS...
Game wont start. Hangs indifinitely at start. Gave up.

review_title: One of the best implementations of VR
one_reviews_text:
Personally, I got the Rift for two purposes: Online combat flight sims and online racing sims. I've been playing Aces High for years and with the Rift the game is elevated to a whole new level. The implementation of VR in this game is the best I've seen in any game.

The Rift really comes alive in an online WW2 combat flight simulation. With no radar and no missiles, armed only with your machine guns and fighter pilot skills, the pilot with the best set of eyes has the upper hand. "Lose sight, lose the fight". In the wild mayhem of a massive multiplayer dogfight arena with hundreds of planes, all piloted by human players, the Rift will give you the upper hand in tracking multiple enemies and maintaining situational awareness. You get to experience WW2 air combat like you've never experienced it before. 

Note: After the free two weeks you will need to subscribe ($15 a month) to access most of the online arenas. 

Warning: Aces High is very addictive!  Highly recommended!!
Doesn"t work, I tried to register to find out why it won't play but they wanted to much personal information so  I canceled out and immediately uninstalled it.
game wont load.
